attacks.name: SQL injection
attacks.summary: Manipulate query logic to extract or alter data at runtime.

variants.name: Union-based SQLi
variants.description: Leverages UNION to extract data from another table.
variants.example: 1 UNION SELECT username, password FROM admin--
variants.detection: Monitor for UNION keyword in input, schema data in responses.
variants.indicators: Structured results with sensitive data, UNION SELECT in logs.

variants.name: Error-based SQLi
variants.description: Forces error messages that leak DB structure.
variants.detection: Look for SQL errors in responses and log entries with ' or --.

variants.name: Boolean-based SQLi
variants.description: Reveals data through true/false conditions without output.
variants.detection: Track similar inputs with different logic, response differences.

variants.name: Time-based SQLi
variants.description: Uses timing to infer logical conditions with no visible output.
variants.detection: Identify queries with delay functions and long response times.

variants.name: Out-of-Band SQLi (OOB)
variants.description: Forces DB to send data to attacker via DNS/HTTP.
variants.detection: Monitor outbound DNS/HTTP requests from DB server.
variants.indicators: External connections from DB server, use of xp_cmdshell.

variants.name: Second-Order SQLi
variants.description: Malicious input saved and executed later when reused.
variants.detection: Track flow of stored inputs, use taint analysis.
variants.indicators: SQL errors triggered later from stored input.

variants.name: Stored SQLi
variants.description: Injection gets stored in DB and runs when displayed.
variants.detection: Scan persistent inputs for SQL metacharacters.

variants.name: Piggy-Backed Queries
variants.description: Executes additional queries; not just data access.
variants.detection: Check for semicolons and multiple SQL statements.
variants.indicators: Multiple operations in one input, data loss.

variants.name: Inline Comment Injection
variants.description: Comments out remaining query to bypass logic.
variants.detection: Look for comment characters in inputs.

variants.name: Alternate Encodings
variants.description: Evades basic filters using encoded input.

attacks.name: Command injection
attacks.summary: Abuse system calls to execute arbitrary commands.

variants.name: Inline chaining
variants.description: Append shell operators to extend a command.

variants.name: Subshell
variants.description: Use shell interpolation to execute nested commands.

attacks.name: Server-side request forgery
attacks.summary: Force servers to reach internal or cloud metadata targets.

variants.name: Metadata probe
variants.description: Query cloud metadata endpoints to discover secrets.

variants.name: Internal pivot
variants.description: Reach services bound to private IP ranges.

attacks.name: JNDI injection
attacks.summary: Trigger remote lookups that can load unexpected code paths.

variants.name: LDAP lookup
variants.description: Use attacker-controlled LDAP endpoints for resolution.

variants.name: RMI lookup
variants.description: Leverage RMI endpoints to chain serialization behavior.

attacks.name: Insecure deserialization
attacks.summary: Inject crafted objects that execute gadget chains.

variants.name: Gadget chain
variants.description: Trigger known gadget chains in serialized payloads.
variants.example: Binary payload with embedded gadget sequence

variants.name: Type confusion
variants.description: Swap expected types to reach unsafe code paths.
variants.example: JSON object with unexpected class hint
